title: Daniel Tolar
text:
Daniel Tolar (born 11 April 1982) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played 101 games for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, primarily as a .
Background.
Tolar was born in <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle, New South Wales</a>.
Playing career.
Tolar made his first grade debut in round 12 of the <a href="2004%20NRL%20season">2004 NRL season</a> against Melbourne. 
In 2005, Tolar made 20 appearances as Newcastle suffered a horrid season on the field finishing last with the wooden spoon. 
In 2010, in reward for his long service at the club, he was awarded the captaincy of the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> in the Round 14 game against the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> due to the absence of regular captain <a href="Kurt%20Gidley">Kurt Gidley</a> and vice-captain <a href="Steve%20Simpson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Steve Simpson</a>.
On 26 September 2011, Tolar announced his retirement from the game after ongoing knee and Achilles tendon injuries.
